channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: He Inherited a Seat in the House of Lords. The UK Government Says He Will Lose It in 2025.
item.description: The U.K. government has pledged to remove hereditary peers from Parliament in 2025. For Lord Cromwell and 87 others, it is a wistful departure.

item.title: Christmas Market Attack in Germany Stirs Political Sniping
item.description: After an assailant driving an S.U.V. killed five people, calls for solidarity have quickly given way to criticism by rival lawmakers, ahead of snap el...

item.title: NASA’s Parker Solar Probe Will Attempt the Closest Ever Pass of the Sun’s Surface
item.description: The Parker Solar Probe is attempting the closest ever pass of the sun’s surface on Christmas Eve.

item.title: Cleaning to Soothe the Worried
item.description: I come from a long line of house cleaners. After Oct. 7, I knew what to do.

item.title: Sorting Fact From Fiction as Fear Engulfs Bangladesh’s Hindus
item.description: Reports of vandalism and mob violence are real, but wilder accusations emanating from India muddy the picture.

item.title: Your Gen Z and millennial employees hate when you use these corporate buzzwords
item.description: The most annoying corporate jargon making young employees roll their eyes has been revealed—and “circle back” is the worst offender.

item.title: Part of Santa Cruz Wharf in California Collapses in High Surf
item.description: Three people were rescued from the wharf. The powerful surf also fatally trapped a man under debris on a beach in Santa Cruz, the authorities said.

item.title: Sorting Fact From Fiction as Fear Engulfs Bangladesh’s Hindus
item.description: Reports of vandalism and mob violence are real, but wilder accusations emanating from India muddy the picture.

item.title: 2024: The year the remote work dial shifted in European bosses’ favor
item.description: Countless bosses have called workers back into the office full-time as the power shifted away from workers in 2024.

item.title: More Americans say they’re picking up side-hustles as widespread layoffs stoke job security fears
item.description: In the wake of widespread layoffs, 20% of Americans with side hustles are actively investing in their secondary income streams.

item.title: Workers won’t accept less than $81,000 for a new role right now—despite fearing they’ll be jobless soon
item.description: Despite fears they may be jobless soon, today’s job seekers' average reservation wage is $81,147—up by almost $20,000 since March 2020.

item.title: Tuesday Briefing
item.description: Here’s what you need to know.

item.title: German medical cannabis companies aren’t coming down from their high—they‘re predicted to bring in $1 billion in sales by 2028
item.description: Germany’s “traffic light” coalition is no more; but when it comes to cannabis, its legacy is here to stay.

item.title: These Students Ousted Bangladesh’s Government. Now They’re Rebuilding a Democracy.
item.description: It is a daunting task for Bangladesh. But an unusual mix of young people and seasoned technocrats are determined to make the most of their opening.

item.title: He Inherited a Seat in the House of Lords. The UK Government Says He Will Lose It in 2025.
item.description: The U.K. government has pledged to remove hereditary peers from Parliament in 2025. For Lord Cromwell and 87 others, it is a wistful departure.
